definitions: The condition of occurring in several different forms.
The occurrence of different forms among the members of a population or colony, or in the life cycle of an individual organism.
The presence of genetic variation within a population, upon which natural selection can operate.
A feature of a programming language that allows routines to use variables of different types at different times.
In biology, polymorphism is the occurrence of two or more clearly different morphs or forms, also referred to as alternative phenotypes, in the population of a species.
